intro: Cnicus pontederae, commonly known as the Pontedera thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a rounded cluster. Cnicus pontederae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal regions.
